docs.snippet: THE past week's development in Italy with regard to the promised retirement of King Victor Emmanuel conceivably foreshadows new Italian postal paper. Even should the sovereign retain his title as King, the circumstance of Crown Prince Humbert's...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE past week's development in Italy with regard to the promised retirement of King Victor Emmanuel conceivably foreshadows new Italian postal paper. Even should the sovereign retain his title as King, the circumstance of Crown Prince Humbert's heading the state would, in the opinion of philatelic observers, result in the issuing of a new series of stamps, with Humbert's picture as the design.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 15 (Delayed) -- The sight of the Stars and Stripes carried by some school children in the parade held on Pan-American Day in the Argentine city of Catamarca so enraged Dr. Ricardo Baldrich, acting federal commissioner of...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 15 (Delayed) -- The sight of the Stars and Stripes carried by some school children in the parade held on Pan-American Day in the Argentine city of Catamarca so enraged Dr. Ricardo Baldrich, acting federal commissioner of the province of the same name, that he demanded immediate resignation of the police chief for permitting the flag of the United States to be exhibited in public.
docs.abstract: Catamarca Prov acting comr R Baldrich enraged at US flag display in children's parade

headline.main: ARGENTINE ENRAGED AT U.S. FLAG DISPLAY; Government Agent Causes Stir at Pan-American Parade

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 18 -- The Argentine press rejoiced on March 28 when the Government issued a "journalists' statute," which was widely advertised as introducing a new era of greater freedom for newspapers. But later events proved the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 18 -- The Argentine press rejoiced on March 28 when the Government issued a "journalists' statute," which was widely advertised as introducing a new era of greater freedom for newspapers. But later events proved the Argentine Government had not abandoned its dictation to the press.
docs.abstract: press suspensions continue on charges of offending govt

headline.main: PRESS IN ARGENTINA IS STILL UNDER CURB; Suspensions Continue on Charges of Offending Government

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 18 -- After only two months' tenure in office as Argentine Minister of Justice and Public Instruction, Dr. J. Honorio Silgueira, who resigned yesterday, did so because he disapproved of the present Government's religious...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 18 -- After only two months' tenure in office as Argentine Minister of Justice and Public Instruction, Dr. J. Honorio Silgueira, who resigned yesterday, did so because he disapproved of the present Government's religious policy, it was learned here today.
docs.abstract: Argentine Cabinet Min resigns as protest against govt decree ordering compulsory teaching in schools

headline.main: ARGENTINE RESIGNS OVER RELIGIOUS ISSUE; Silgueira Quit Cabinet Because of Compulsory School Teaching

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 21 -- The Argentine Government issued a decree this morning forbidding all popular manifestations that had been planned for May Day. This apparently was done to spare the Government the embarrassment that would undoubtedly...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 21 -- The Argentine Government issued a decree this morning forbidding all popular manifestations that had been planned for May Day. This apparently was done to spare the Government the embarrassment that would undoubtedly be created by two simultaneous mass meetings, one organized by the Nationalists under the name of the "March of Sovereignty" and another by the labor unions.
docs.abstract: Argentine Govt takes over storage facilities

headline.main: Argentina Bans May Day Rallies To Spare Regime Embarrassment; Nationalist Parade Is Dropped Along With Labor Demonstration -- State Takes Over Grain Storage Facilities

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The Canadian free dollar moved irregularly lower last week, slipping from 90.38 cents at the outset to 90.12 cents at the close, for a loss of 1/8 cent from the preceding week. Several of the South American currencies also sagged, but all other...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Canadian free dollar moved irregularly lower last week, slipping from 90.38 cents at the outset to 90.12 cents at the close, for a loss of 1/8 cent from the preceding week. Several of the South American currencies also sagged, but all other descriptions remained firm.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED APRIL 22, 1944

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 24 -- The Official organ of the Argentine Socialists, The Vanguardia, has been closed by the police for an indeterminate, period as the result of its repeated criticisms of various points of the Government's policy,...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 24 -- The Official organ of the Argentine Socialists, The Vanguardia, has been closed by the police for an indeterminate, period as the result of its repeated criticisms of various points of the Government's policy, especially compulsory religious instruction in the schools.
docs.abstract: Socialist organ suspended after warning against backing US

headline.main: Argentina Closes Socialist Newspaper After Warning Against Supporting U.S.
